Okay. I've done some research, and I'm about to say something so important, so important that you will not believe how important it is. Anyway, are you ready? Because if you're not ready then tell me. Okay, I'm about to say it. The most important thing ever. Here goes nothing. I'm about to do it. You better be ready. Okay, I'm ready to say it. Wait, are you ready? Okay so you're ready? Wait, I'm confused if you're ready or not. Anyway, I'm about to say it. The most important thing you will ever hear in your life. I'm ready when you are. Okay I'm ready, how about you? Okay so you're ready? Good. Okay. I'm about to say it. The most important thing ever. It's really important. I'm still waiting for you to say if you're ready. Okay you're ready? Good. Amazing. Fantastic. I'm running out of things to say. Okay. Here goes nothing. I'm ready when you are. Alright. Here we go. The most important thing you will ever see someone type. Okay. I'm ready. You're ready (hopefully). Get the popcorn and soda ready. Okay, here it goes. The most important thing ever. Alright. Here it goes. I'm ready and you are to. Okay, let's do this. Here goes nothing,
Shit I forgot.﻿

Gra od początku do końca potrafi zaskoczyć i posiada ciekawą fabułę, która jest bardzo fajnie opowiadana wraz z pojawiającymi się kolejnymi zagadkami. Twórcom udało się stworzyć parę ciekawych osobowości, których monologów wysłuchuje się przez całość gry i niejednokrotnie rozśmieszają. Wszystko w tej produkcji jest stworzone "w sam raz", zagadki nie nudzą, nie powrarzają się, czas potrzebny do ukończenia gry nie jest ani za długi ani za krótki. Twórcom nawet udało się z napisów końcowych zmontować coś ciekawego.

Grę można polecić każdemu i naprawdę nie wiem do czego można by się przyczepić. Jest perfekcyjna.

Portal 2 è veramente un capolavoro. Divertentissimo sia nella campagna giocatore singolo (dove si dovranno affrontare vari test sempre diversi tra loro) che nella campagna co-op con gli amici. Inoltre a me è piaciuta molto l'intelligenza artificiale dei robot, rendendo l'esperienza videoludica molto divertente e carina. Voto 92/100

Ein großartiges Puzzle-Spiel!

Wer Portal 1 geliebt hat, wird auch bei Portal 2 für viele Stunden nicht mehr vom PC wegkommen. Die Single Player Kampagne ist diesmal ungefähr 2-3 x so lang wie die in Teil 1, dazu kommt ein sehr liebevoll gestalteter Co-Op Modus, den man ebenfalls noch sehr viele Stunden mit einem Freund zusammen duchspielen kann. Die Puzzles sind abwechslungsreich und anspruchsvoll, die Leveldesigns innovativ und oftmals ein Hingucker.

Und der Plot?

GlaDOS ist einmal mehr in Hochform und bereichert beide Kampagnen mit zahlreichen Einspielern über die Lautsprecheranlage, die den Spieler aufgrund ihres sarkastischen Untertons erneut oft genug zum Schmunzeln bringen. Mit dem tollpatschigen Sidekick Wheatley sowie den alten Aufzeichnungen von Firmengründer Cave Johnson kommen diesmal aber auch noch andere Stimmen zur Wort, die normalerweise der allgemeinen Spielatmosphäre durchaus gut tun.

Insgesamt ein überragendes Spiel, welches viele Stunden Spielspaß garantieren sollte.
very good game indeed, well thought and very cool especially that potatOS and "when life gives ya lemons, dont make lemonade, TAKE THE LEMONS BACK!"

그래, 너 임마.

У Portal 2 есть огромный изъян. Её мало. 14 часов одиночной кампании и «коопа» пролетают мгновенно. Рука так и тянется к «New Game», чтобы пройти игру снова, наслаждаясь умными головоломками и острыми, как лезвие бритвы, репликами героев. Но в одну реку не войти дважды — чертова память цепко держит каждую задачку. Остается слушать божественную арию из финального ролика или выход DLC — смотря что произойдет быстрее.

Great game!!! Great plot and even better graphics! Definately a good buy!

-- Pros: -- 
- (VERY) Entertaining gameplay for a puzzle game
- Portal gun!
- Funny moments
- GLaDOS jokes how useless you are
- Awesome story-line
- Many easter eggs and references
- Decent graphics
- Lots and lots of fun as for single and multiplayer.
- Gaben Newel appears to be a pile of cubes (Singleplayer credits)

-- Cons: --
- Unfinished story (There's so much more to know!)
- SPOILER - Wheatly becomes evil and ends up in space :c
- Not enough levels (While there are tons of them, you still want more.. MORE!)
- SPOILER - GLaDOS becomes POTATO
- Seems VALVe isn't going to release the third part of franchise any time soon
好顶赞！相比起portal 1 来说单人剧情模式游戏时间长了很多，而且多了许多1里面没有的装置。场景也变得比1里面更大，除了考察解密能力之外，还提高了对玩家的观察能力的要求。自己动手改变地形的玩法不能更棒/w\。总体来说更大更长更好玩！

这是我第一个打完后差点哭出来的游戏。
这是我第一个想通过评测把自己打完后的感受写出来的游戏。
首先，我要给那些还没入的人说一句：V社出品，必属精品。你特么还没入是什么意思？
V社也学会了育碧一样了啊？一部游戏拆成两部卖。。。如果买的话建议两部一起买，先打1再打2。XD
以下为剧透内容。
[spoiler]先前打1代的时候，GLaDOS还是一个彻头彻尾的大反派，很像2代的Wheatley（好像是这么拼的吧，不管它），直到Chell（好像也是这么拼的吧）把她杀死，到那个时候我还单纯地以为GLaDOS就是这么一个大AI，冷血，无情，用尽各种办法想把妹子主角置于死地。
“这不是勇气，这是谋杀。我有对不起你吗？”——GLaDOS《Portal1》
但是到了2代，随着Wheatley的出现，剧情开始变得更一波三折。其实如果把这个系列拍成一部电影，也绝对是一部好片。开头对主角伸手相助的Wheatley转眼间变成了大反派，而开始千方百计想要让主角死的GLaDOS在后期反而变成了her best friend，陪着主角一起度过个个难关，而一直想要主角死的态度也渐渐好转（有了共同的敌人）。最终战胜大BOSS之后，GLaDOS夺回了自己的身体，仿佛变成了Caroline一般（虽然我至今不明这两人之间有何JQ），和主角成了BF，用炮塔奏乐送主角回到了外面的麦田（打到这里我开始想哭的）。而在太空的Whealtey最后的一句话让我彻底泪奔。
整部游戏的语言也充满了美式幽默，值得一看。
I only want you gone.——GLaDOS《Portal2》[/spoiler]
Love the game play co-op with a friend and with maps from the workshop is fun

This has got to be one of the most fun, most rewarding and entertaining experiences I have had in a game.
First I simply played the single-player and enjoyed it a lot, felt I received my moneys worth. But after playing a bit of coop with my sister I just felt inspired to get around and write a review.
So where to begin? Perhaps gameplay. It takes a gimmick, shooting portals to travel, manipulate stuff and ultimately solve puzzles. Portal 2 runs with the gimmick and, in true Valve-style, creates puzzles which feel more rewarding and organic than typical videogame puzzles, where it usually feels like you are trying to mind-read a cryptic all-powerful creature, a creature which tries its best to mask what it wants from you, which punishes every experimentation and failure harshly and without even giving you a clue of where you went wrong.
Instead, Portal does things like Half-Life 2 did (I touched upon it in my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561197976091020/recommended/220/]HL2 review here[/url]), there´s more of a sense of observing, putting things together without too much arbitrary design choices and rules which never seem to stay consistent and trustworthy. Portal 1 and 2 has some arbitrary things like portals firing upon white surfaces, but it makes this clear and stick with this rule, it creates an environment where learning the rules is not useless, but you keep adding them up lawfully, like a scientist exploring how the game universe operates.
It´s fun to figure puzzles out, rewarding, and you can incrementally add up the steps, instead of having to hold in mind a complicated maze and then have to succeed on your first try or start from scratch. I mean, you can and have to strategize, but it can be done in parts, and it is more organic, than feeling gamey, like having to remember the way to put some tilepuzzles together from some scrap of a picture you caught a glimpse of earlier in the game.
The Single-Player story was fun, the pacing, telling, the little details you can pay attention to or run past are immersive. I could go on, but many of the strengths of Valve games are here in Portal 2, so what I´ve said about HL2 applies, in the style of relying on atmosphere, environments and observation, coupled with narration. It was a well rounded satisfying experience. I´ll admit it´s now some months since I played SP so I can´t go to more details, but my impression is still very positive. I still have a general idea of the actual substance of the story, it was a bit whacky at times, a scifi story with comedic twists and turns, but it was still told well and had the content was enjoyable, even Wheatley for me, though I´ve heard some were annoyed by that character.
But the coop has been utterly fabulous. From the simple way to invite friends and jump into the game, the joy of figuring things out and the game giving the tools to allow you to communicate effectively (mic obviously a tool available), with pings with options to point out where to stand, what to look at, how to interact with, the remote view which allows you to see things from your friends perspective, and just the dynamic, organic humour of flying around portals, messing around, gesturing in a silly way, taunting Glados-- I haven´t played it yet fully, but I expect many more similarly enjoyable rich hours. There´s some story in there as well, it feels like Valve wanted the coop to be rich enough to stand equally strong on the SP campaign side. Some even like the coop more than SP, and I´m starting to see why.
As a source engine, the game looks beautiful, plays solidly with little problems, bugs or performance issues, and is a great open engine allowing tweaks and mods. The game has Workshop and will possibly add even more fun to play, both SP and coop.
If I were someone to give scores, my initial playthrough would have been a solid lovely 8-9/10, but now after starting to fool around with coop, this is simply 10+ out of ten for me.
